TextView.android:text: 1)Which of the following quantities consists of S.I. unit as Hertz?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Frequency defined as the number of cycles per second and discovered by German \n physicist Heinrich Hertz. The S.I. unit of frequency is Hertz.
2)Which one of the following units is a fundamental unit?
View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 The ampere is the basic unit specifically in the SI unit system of measurement but other 
 systems of measurement use different base units. Newton, Watt and Joules/sec are 
 constructed by more than one fundamental unit.
3)Which of the quantity consists of SI unit as Candela?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Candela is the unit of luminous intensity. Luminous intensity is the amount of light \n emitting from a point source per unit of solid angle from a point source.
4)Which of the quantity consists of unit as Pascal?
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n Pascal is the SI unit for pressure named after Blaise Pascal, French mathematician. Force \n per unit area is known as pressure.
5)Which of the quantity consists of unit as newton-second?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n The SI unit of impulse is called Newton second (N-s) \n Integral of force over a time is called impulse.
6)Which of the quantity consists of unit as kg m/sec ?
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n The kilogram-meter per second is the standard unit of momentum. \n It is the product of mass and velocity.
7)What is the standard unit for length ?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n The basis of length units for the metric system is the meter \n It is the international standard SI unit of length.
8)What is the name of physical quantities which are independent of each other?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n The fundamental quantities are those which are independent and are not derived from \n other quantities example length, mass, temperature etc.
9)The Metric System is also called as:
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n The metric system uses the three base units: \n Length, Mass, Volume. MKS system (Meter,Kilogram, Second).
10)Which devices used to measure the temperature of an object ?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n A thermometer is a device that measures temperature or temperature gradient
11)What are the SI units of mass, length and time respectively?
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n Kilogram, metre and second are the SI units of mass, length and time respectively.
12)Which of the two have same dimensions?
View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 Angular Velocity (ω) is change in angular displacement per unit time. It is also expressed as linear velocity/displacement 
 So, dimension of ‘ω’= MoLT -1/L = T -1.
 Angular Frequency (f) is defined as rate of change of angular displacement. It is the reciprocal of time period. So dimension of ‘f’ is T -1.
 Hence, dimensional formula of angular velocity is same as dimensional formula of angular frequency.
13)How many fundamental units are there ?
View Answer

Answer : Option C \n There are seven fundamental units: kilogram (mass), meter(length), candela (luminous intensity), second (time), ampere (current), kelvin (temperature), and mole (amount of substance).
14)What is the unit of plane angle?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n The derived SI unit for plane angle is radian (rad).
15) Resistance of a VARISTOR varies with
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n A varistor (variable resistor) is an electronic component whose electronic resistance varies with the applied voltage. It is also known as voltage dependent resistor (VDR).
16)Relative permittivity can be measured by _______ bridge
View Answer

Answer : Option D \n The word relative permittivity is associated with the capacitance. Since, the Scherings bridge is used to find out the unknown value of capacitance, dielectric loss, relative permittivity.
17)_______ is used to measure the flow of air around aeroplane.
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n The basic application of anemometer is to measure the wind velocity (or) flow of air. It is applicable in aeroplane, wind mills, etc.
18)Null type recorders are

RadioButton.android:text: D) any one of the above.

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option C \n The recorders based on the working principle of self balancing or null conditions are called potentiometric recorders.
19)The chemical effect of current is used in
View Answer

Answer : Option A \n The battery is rated in terms of ampere hour. The chemical effect of current is created by the batteries. Hence, the DC ampere hour meter is used to measure the ampere hour rating of the battery.
20)A galvanometer with a full scale current of 10 mA has a resistance of 1000 Ω. The multiplying power (the ratio of measured current to galvanometer current) of 100 Ω shunt with this galvanometer is
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n
